step.cmd: Teacher: creates an assignment (see ), fills in metadata and instructions for students and (optionally) attaches files for the students to work upon.

Teacher: publishes the assignment (see ). Publishing an assignment involves specifying students to whom the assignment is being handed out, a deadline, and (optionally) additional instructions pertaining to this particular publication. Once an assignment is published it becomes active.
Students: receive the assignment (see ) and start working on it. Once an assignment is published, it will appear in the list of active assignments in student interface upon startup.
Teacher: monitors student progress (see ); reviews student work; optionally performs intermediate grading; optionally sends submitted work back for revision; comments on work in progress.
Teacher: finishes grading and issues final grades for the assignment (see ); (optionally) files completed assignment to the archive (see ), and creates assignment report (see )
Students: receive final grade for the assignment and review teacher comments (see )
Teacher: finalizes the assignment (see ) at which point it is considered closed.
